definition: dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]

sentences.english: The land cracked and the springs dried up and the cattle listlessly nibbled dry twings.
sentences.chinese: 土地龟裂，泉水干枯，牛儿无精打采地啃着干树枝。

sentences.english: But more mouthed along listlessly or stared in silence.
sentences.chinese: 但更多的人只是无精打采地张着嘴或默默地发呆。

sentences.english: The sound roused Nikol from her dread lethargy.
sentences.chinese: 这个声音唤醒了无精打采的妮可。

sentences.english: I’m often unshaven, dressed in sweats, slouched at my desk.
sentences.chinese: 我常常不刮胡子，穿着汗衫，无精打采地坐在桌子上。

sentences.english: Inside the farmer's barn, a couple dozen cows stand listlessly in stalls.
sentences.chinese: 在农场的牛栏里，十几头奶牛无精打采的站着。

sentences.english: Seeing her beloved owner leave, she also feels gloomy, neglect others, and huddle up in a corner, unanimated.
sentences.chinese: 学会了冷落人，她蜷在小角落里，无精打采的。
共和党人都很无精打采。

sentences.english: Not only the fish held still, but the potted ivy lost spirits also.
sentences.chinese: 不仅是鱼儿无精打采，连盆栽的常春藤也没了生气。

sentences.english: She had been watching TV and listlessly answering my questions.
sentences.chinese: 她一直在看着电视，无精打采地回答着我的问题。

sentences.english: The baby was listless, his skin a pale yellowish-white.
sentences.chinese: 孩子无精打采，皮肤苍白而微微发黄。

sentences.english: TaJoe said listlessly that maybe he had learned his lesson.
sentences.chinese: 塔乔无精打采地说，也许他接受了教训。

sentences.english: I why in poor fettle every day of?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我天天无精打采的？

sentences.english: Their posture may be slouched and you may perceive a lack of confidence.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是无精打采的站着，感觉缺乏自信。

sentences.english: In our losses, it seems like we play listlessly and spiritless .
sentences.chinese: 在那些失败的场次中，我们打得无精打采。

sentences.english: Consequently, you may experience fatigue or listlessness without realizing why.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你可能会莫名其妙地感到疲劳或无精打采。

sentences.english: She poked at her meal unenthusiastically.
sentences.chinese: 她无精打采地拨弄着盘中的饭菜。

definition: listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
dull and colorless (idiom); lacking vitality/not lively
looking or feeling sickly/weak and dispirited through illness
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
in great spirits/to have great vitality
